rounds.comments: (Alex: We want you to name the husband.)

clues.text:
Martha Custis
(1759-1799)

(1964-1974, 1975-1976)

(1533-1536)

(1945-1952)

(1796-1809)
The aptly-named Terry Frost created a painting called this season of the year "1956, Yorkshire"
Fittingly, this woman holds a Tudor rose in the portrait by Nicholas Hilliard seen here
William Hodges journeyed to the south Pacific as an artist to this captain & painted the portrait of him seen here
John Hoppner, a favorite royal portrait artist of the late 1700s, was rumored to be an illegitimate son of this king
This contemporary Brit has long been in the swim with paintings such as "Peter Getting Out of Nick's Pool"
His "Albert Hall" concert of 1966 was finally released in 1998 after decades of bootlegging
On Jan. 6, 1975 "Another World" became the first daytime drama to go to this many minutes
1911's "The Durbar at Delhi" was the first major film made using this visual advance
Disney's first direct-to-video feature was the "Aladdin" sequel "The Return of" this villain
In 1955 the Independent Television Authority broke this corporation's monopoly on TV in England
Forced to resign as director of this, William Colby was replaced by George Bush
E. Howard Hunt worked initially with this future radio host on many covert activities
Last name of representative John or columnist Jack, who covered the Watergate scandal
Later chief of staff, this adman became Nixon's campaign manager in 1968 & handled the puff 'n stuff pieces
This Indiana senator led the fight against Nixon's Carswell & Haynsworth Supreme Court nominations
In the U.S. it's 16 fluid ounces
In 3/8 time it's 3 beats long
In Greece this many lepta equal 1 drachma
60 minutes -- on a map
1 sievert is the dose of radiation from 1 milligram of this element in 1 hour at a distance of 1 centimeter
This "Saint Joan" playwright hated Shakespeare so much it would "Be a relief to...dig him up and throw stones at him"
"Life is divided into the horrible and the miserable", said Woody Allen in this 1977 film
"The play was a great success, but the audience was a total failure", he said after "Lady Windemere's Fan" debuted
Some would "rather read a book about civil servants written by a rabbit" than this bunny book by Richard Adams
"I find mankind so odious that I should hate to have it approve of me", Alceste says in this Moliere comedy
This brand has been jokingly called "ham that failed its physical"
Ham lover seen here:
This company that makes canned deviled ham once used the slogan "Branded with the devil but fit for the gods"
To be given this name, hams must be cured & processed in the Virginia area of the same name
Parma ham is the true form of this, Italian for "ham"
In a 1933 film this big ape was brought to America from his island home on a huge raft
In 1982 this film's original Japanese version, "Gojira", was shown in America without Raymond Burr's scene
The old Gypsy Maleva tells this dead character, "Your suffering is over...now find peace for eternity"
Dr. Jack Griffin was the real name of this Claude Rains character; there's more to him than meets the eye
Also known as the Gill-Man, he was played by Ben Chapman; underwater scenes were done by Ricou Browning
clues.response: The Creature from the Black Lagoon

clues.text: Galen's neighbors heard the squeals of stuck pigs when he proved that veins carry this, not air
In 1952 Hershey & Chase used a Waring model of this machine to study bacteria-eating viruses
Josef Stefan heated up physics by showing that radiation from a glowing wire was proportional to this
NASA's passive seismic experiment detected thousands of lunar seismic events, called these
1887's Michelson-Morley experiment demolished the idea of this medium that supposedly conducted light
When the new "Love Boat" set sail in 1998, this "Vega$" star was in the captain's seat
This "Exodus" author returned in 1999 with a new political novel, "A God In Ruins"
In 1987 he outraced his son to win his fourth Indianapolis 500
This Norwegian star of such movies as "Autumn Sonata" was actually born in Japan
Once a staff writer for The New Yorker, this "Rabbit, Run" author still contributes regularly
In 1990 these insects on the lam from South America since 1957 reached Texas
The Aum Shinrikyo cult was behind a March 1995 nerve gas attack on this city's subway
"(Hi, I'm Billy Warlock of "General Hospital") In the TV movie "Honor Thy Father And Mother:  The True Story Of" these "Murders", I played Lyle"
To get the crown for himself, this Shakespearean king murders 2 little princes
The savage Gilles de Rais probably inspired this "colorful" character who keeps bodies in a locked room
In the '60s it meant trendy or hip, like a member of a TV "Squad"
For 5 & 7 it's 12
A criminal charge, it's listed on a "sheet"
I can't tell either of these 2 3-letter words; I only tell the truth
A gullible person, or the juice in a tree

rounds.text: In 170 A.D. Melito of Sardis compiled a list of religious works to be included in this, a 2-word term he coined
